Posts.Title: Kicking LE's butt!! Exercise & Self Care Log Tina337 Flynn

Posts.Content: joannnc wrote: I have a friend (male) who recently was diagnosed with breast cancer.  He has had a mastectomy (tumor was about 5 centimeters).  He also had 23/23 positive nodes.  He will have chemo and radiation and also a cat scan. Is there anyone out here who had a large number of positive lymph nodes removed and is still out there after five years.  I would love to hear from you.   Hugs, JoAnn  JoAnn Dx 3/17/2003, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/22 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 23 nodes removed - all positive joannnc Beverly11

Posts.Content: May 22, 2017 08:41AM joannnc wrote: I know that these sleeves (juzo brand) give sun protection because by the end of summer I have one very tan arm and one very white arm.  Ha Ha.  The tips of my fingers where I wear a glove are also tan.  I even wear my garments when I swim to avoid taking them on and off.
Posts.Title: Sunscreen needed under compression sleeve? tessu Outfield

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2019 08:46AM joannnc wrote: I got LE in 2004.  I only wore the sleeve.  I did have a glove but only wore it for flying (about 2x a year).  I do not even know it was the right size.  Anyway, in 2014 by hand blew up terribly.  I went to a therapist and needed to be wrapped for several weeks.  Now I wear a Juzo compression glove expert in size 4.  I had a very hard time adjusting to the glove.  I felt like I had LE all over again.  Every case is different.  I see women who only wear sleeve.  However, I do live in a small town and do not see people very often with LE.  Good luck to you whatever you decide.  Sometimes I do not wear compression; however, I never wear sleeve without glove.
Posts.Title: Sleeve but no glove? Manuella JO-5

Posts.Content: joannnc wrote: Does anyone have an MRI done on a yearly basis as a follow up for cancer diagnosis?  I have a digital mammogram done yearly and an MRI done yearly since I have extremely dense breast tissue.  I am wondering what has turned up on these MRIs.  I hear that you can get a great deal of false positives on MRIs.  Anyway, I was told today that I have a small lesion in the same breast that the cancer was in five years ago.  I had a lumpectomy at that time.  I need to go for a biopsy next week and of course I am concerned.  Any feedback anyone can give me about their experience with an MRI will be greatly appreciated.  Hugs, JoAnn JoAnn Dx 3/17/2003, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/22 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: MRI joannnc joannnc

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2014 09:35PM joannnc wrote: In response to the question by Purple 32 - Do you wear a glove?   In Dec., 2004 when I was first diagnosed with lymphedema I purchased a sleeve and glove.  I did not like the glove and only wore it when flying (about 2x a year).  I did wear the sleeve almost daily and my lymphedema seemed to be "under control."  Last month I had a flare up where my hand swelled terribly.  I have found an LE therapist in my area and right now I am wrapped in compression bandages. I was told that I must wear a glove from now on.  Needless to say, I am not happy about this but I have no choice if I don't want my hand lymphedema to continue to swell and get worse.
Posts.Title: ALL THINGS Gloves and sleeves purple32 tsoebbin
